question: A 10-year-old child is brought to the hospital with complaints of bloody diarrhea for the past 3 days. Examination and labs reveal an acute kidney injury along with thrombocytopenia. Upon taking history, the parents said that their child had an E. coli infection for the past few days. Which one of the following cells is most likely to be seen in this condition?
Which one of the following is used as an antidote for heparin?

A girl presented to the emergency with a complaint of easy bruising and petechia, which is on and off. Her brother also suffered from the same condition. The lab results of the girl showed increased bleeding and partial thromboplastin time. Which one of the following conditions was she suffering from?

A 65-year-old male presents with a 2-month history of fever and weight loss. On examination, the spleen is palpable 6 cm below the left costal margin. Complete blood count (CBC) reveals leukocytes=125x10⁹/L, hemoglobin=7.0 gm/dL and platelets= 510X10³/µL . He is diagnosed with chronic myeloid leukemia. Which of the following defects is present in chronic myeloid leukemia?
An eye witness claims the victims death occurred about 12 hours ago. Which of the finding will confirm the statement?

answers.option: Rise in potassium content of vitreous humor
Increase in chemical constituents of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF)

question: The process of decomposition in the air is twice as rapid as in water and eight times as rapid as in the soil. What is the name of this process?

A child presents with an enlarged spleen and jaundice. His laboratory findings include an increased red blood cell width, spherocytes with loss of pallor, and increased mean corpuscular hemoglobin concentration (MCHC). Which of the following would be a possible diagnosis?
A child suffering from hemolytic uremic syndrome will have which one of the following finding in his peripheral blood smear?

During the autopsy of a man, the coroner determines his age to be below sixty due to noting that a skull suture has not yet fused. Which of the following correctly identifies this particular skull suture?

A 25-year-old male presents to the clinic with easy fatigability and generalized weakness. On examination he has blood pressure (BP)=110/60 mm of Hg, looks pale, and has koilonychia. His complete blood count (CBC) shows: Hb=9.7 g/dl, MCV=69 fl, MCHC=26 g/dl. What is the most likely cause of anemia in this patient?

A fresh victim of a road traffic accident is brought to the emergency department but lost his life on the way to the hospital. To confirm his death, the body is examined for all immediate signs of death. Which of the following is an immediate sign of death?
Which of the following statements describe the working of alteplase?
Heinz bodies in erythrocytes are characteristic features of which one of the following enzymatic deficiencies?
When does the pisiform bone begin to ossify?
Which of the following is the surest sign to determine that hanging was ante-mortem, rather than post-mortem?
A 16-17-year-old male has been sent to you for age determination. A radiograph of which of the following would be used for this purpose?

A young boy is arrested due to a criminal charge. The court orders a detailed forensic examination to determine his age. Pelvic X-ray findings show that the ischium and pubis are not yet fused. What is the approximate age of the boy?

A 21-year-old female presents with petechiae on her skin and episodes of epistaxis for the last two months. On examination, there is no hepatosplenomegaly or lymphadenopathy. Which of the following is the most sensitive earliest test for making a diagnosis?
Which of the following drugs binds to ADP receptors on platelets and thus inhibits platelet aggregation?

The dead body of a young female is recovered from her house hanging from a fan. On examination, it is seen that post mortem lividity in lower limbs has fully developed and blanches on applying pressure. What will be the probable time elapsed since the death?
Which of the following chromosomal abnormality is not observed in myelodysplastic syndrome?
Which interleukin is required for the growth and proliferation of all the stem cells?

A 6-year-old boy develops sudden pallor and jaundice. He has taken fava beans. His Hb is 3.5 g/dl with normal TLC and platelets. Total bilirubin was 5 mg/dl, predominantly unconjugated and the reticulocyte count is > 20 hps. Urine is also positive for Hb. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A body of a person whose epidermis got burnt was brought to the forensic department for identification. Which of the following methods is the most feasible one?

answers.option: Collect burnt skin and take its print
Take fingerprints as dermis is not burnt

question: A 45-year-old woman presented to the emergency department with acute diarrhea and abdominal discomfort for 2 weeks. Stool culture shows parasitic eggs. Which cells would be raised in complete blood count?

A detective is searching for evidence at a crime scene when he encounters fingerprints on the doorknob. He takes the impressions for examination. Inspection reveals a pattern in which ridges run from left to right. What is the most likely fingerprint pattern in this case?

A patient presented to the clinic with lymphadenopathy. A lymph node biopsy showed small lymphoid cells having a nodular appearance with prominent nucleoli. The cells were found to be CD5+ and Tdt negative. Further workup revealed (11:14) translocation. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following will not be seen in the case of multiple myeloma?

answers.option: Cast in urine and pus cells

question: A clinical study of patients who inherit mutations that reduce the level of ankyrin, the principal binding site for spectrin, in the RBC membrane cytoskeleton shows an increased prevalence of chronic anemia with splenomegaly. For many patients, it is observed that splenectomy reduces the severity of anemia. This beneficial effect of splenectomy is most likely related to which of the following processes?

answers.option: Decrease in opsonization of RBCs and lysis in spleen
Decrease in splenic RBC sequestration and lysis
Increase in deformability of RBCs within splenic sinusoids
Increase in splenic storage of iron
Decrease in production of reactive oxygen species by splenic macrophages

question: A 13-year-old female presents to the outpatient department (OPD) with on and off menorrhagia, bleeding gums, and petechial rashes. Her laboratory reports show the following results; Hb= 12.5 g/dl, platelet count= 350,000/mm3, activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT)= 49s (normal: 29-40s). Which of the following could be the likely diagnosis?

A 70-year-old man has experienced increasing fatigue for the past 6 months. On physical examination, he has non-tender axillary and cervical lymphadenopathy but no hepatosplenomegaly. The CBC shows hemoglobin, 9.5 g/dL; hematocrit, 28%; MCV, 90 μm³; platelet count, 120,000/mm³; and WBC count, 42,000/mm³. His peripheral blood smear shows a monotonous population of small, round, mature-looking lymphocytes. Flow cytometry shows these cells as CD19+, CD5+, CD23-, and deoxynucleotidyl transferase negative (TdT−). Cytogenetic and molecular analysis of the abnormal cells in his blood will most likely reveal which of the following alterations?

answers.option: Clonal rearrangement of T-cell receptor genes

question: Which of the following is the process of giving preformed antibodies or vaccines to a person?
Which of these live attenuated vaccines is contraindicated during pregnancy?
In postmortem examination of the body, the tattoo marks disappear from the skin. Which of the following should be examined?
For how long should the warfarin therapy be discontinued if a patient is given vitamin K?
Mycobacterium cannot be gram stained because of the presence of which substance in its cell wall?
A skull is found to have oval orbits, a sharp chin, an obtuse angle of the mandible, and smooth facial contours. The skull is more likely to belong to which of the following options?
A dead body is found with complete calcification of the third molar. Which of the following could be the age of this person before death?
In what part of the body does postmortem lividity develop if the body was floating in the water?
Which of the following is the mechanism of action of alteplase?
A person is brought to the emergency department with shortness of breath and syncope and is identified to have angina. Which of the following anticoagulants should be given to the patient?
Which of the following is the most potent thrombolytic agent but causes an increased epitope presentation?

A 45-year-old female with chronic hypertension presents to the outpatient department with petechial rashes. Laboratory shows platelet counts of 50,000. The prothrombin time (PT) and partial thromboplastin time (PTT) are both in a normal range. However, the bleeding time is elevated. Which of the following is the cause of her condition?

A 45-year-old male patient presents to the outpatient department with painless lymphadenopathy in the neck and axilla. He also reports experiencing night sweats, and unexplained weight loss for the past few weeks. On physical examination, the nodes are firm and non-tender. There is no evidence of hepatosplenomegaly. The lymph nodes are of different sizes. Which of the following can be a likely cause of his condition?
A newborn feeds on cow milk 5 times a day. Which of the following can develop jaundice and pallor in this baby?
Which of the following worm infestations cause severe anemia during pregnancy?
A 7-year-old boy develops jaundice and severe anemia after consuming fava beans. Which of the following is the cause of his condition?

A 25-year-old female is transfused blood. After two weeks, she presents to the outpatient department for a follow-up with anemia, fever, and chills. Her direct Coombs test is positive. Which of the following is the cause of her condition?

answers.option: Delayed hemolytic reaction due to ABO blood group
Acute hemolytic reaction to minor groups
Acute hemolytic reaction due to Rh group

question: Which of the following is an antidote for acute iron poisoning?
What is the number of teeth in a 9-year-old?
Which of the following is a direct plasminogen activator?

A 12-year-old boy presents to the OPD with a complaint of jaundice. He is afebrile and jaundiced on examination. The spleen is palpable 3 cm below the level of the left costal margin. Blood CB shows Hb: 8.5, leukocytes: 10,000, platelets: 230,000, MCV: 90, MCHC: 40, and reticulocytes: 30%. Red blood cells lack central pallor. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A young boy presents to the OPD with an inability to walk. There is marked swelling of his left knee. His mother gives a history of profuse bleeding following a minor surgery two years ago. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A guy got into a road traffic accident and sustained wounds on his leg. He does not have a history of prior tetanus vaccination. After decontamination of the wound, what will the next best management?

answers.option: Tetanus toxoid and tetanus immune globulin (TIG)
Administer tetanus immune globulin (TIG) as well as tetanus toxoid and call him the next day for the second dose of tetanus toxoid
Administer tetanus immune globulin (TIG) as well as tetanus toxoid and call him one month later for the second dose of tetanus toxoid

question: Which of the following types of vaccine is avoided in pregnancy?
Which of the following is the best statement regarding the use of vitamin B12 and folic acid?

answers.option: They are always given together in cases of deficiency
Vitamin B12 is used to treat pernicious anemia
Vitamin B12 is given for neural tube defects
DNA synthesis is impaired only when both vitamin B12 and folic acid are deficient

question: A 12-year-old boy has hemophilia. Which of the following statements is most likely to be accurate?

answers.option: His sister must be a carrier
His brother must also have hemophilia
His sister cannot be a carrier

question: Which of the following is the most common cause of neutropenia?

A mother gave birth to a child at 39 weeks. It was a stillbirth and the baby showed ‘hydrops foetalis’. Upon Hb electrophoresis of the baby, Hb Barts was observed. Which of the following is true regarding this condition?

A child presents with a bleeding disorder. According to his mother, his uncle has the same problem. He is diagnosed with hemophilia. Which of the following tests will be used to confirm the diagnosis?
Which of the following is a side effect of oral iron therapy?
Which of the following receptors is used by erythropoietin to exert its effects?
A mother brought her child to the outpatient department with a complaint of allergic rhinitis. Which of the following is most likely to be raised in the patient's blood?

A mother, who had been on epilepsy drugs throughout her pregnancy, brings her 2-month-old child to the OPD with a complaint of sudden onset anal bleeding. What is the most likely reason for the bleeding?
What is the difference between instantaneous rigor and rigor mortis?

answers.option: In instantaneous rigor, only few involuntary muscles contract
Instantaneous rigor can be used to determine the time since death
Primary relaxation occurs in instantaneous rigor
Instantaneous rigor develops 1-2 hours after death
Instantaneous rigor can be used to determine the manner of death

question: Reed Sternberg cells are positive for which of the following cell markers?
Which of the following is characteristically seen in multiple myeloma?

A woman develops a sudden headache and blurring of vision without having any history of such mental deficits. However, she occasionally experiences chest pain and shortness of breath. Which of the following conditions is responsible for these deficits?
A patient presented to the outpatient department with recurrent bleeding, infections, pallor, and jaundice. Which of the following would you find on bone marrow biopsy?

A patient presents to the outpatient department with jaundice and pallor. On her last visit, she was diagnosed with chronic anemia. A blood test is performed and it is observed that the reticulocyte count is reduced. Which of the following could be the reason for this patient's anemia?

answers.option: Viral infection of the bone marrow (aplastic crisis)

question: A male patient comes to you for a follow-up visit. He has a history of thromboembolism for which he was started on a low-molecular-weight heparin (LMWH). However, he did not achieve adequate anticoagulation on LMWH. Therefore, he was started on warfarin. Which of the following was most likely used to monitor the status of anticoagulation?
A 2-day-old neonate presents to you with jaundice and pallor. His mother is B- and he is A+. Which of the following tests would you perform to confirm your diagnosis?

A 32-year-old woman presented to the clinic with complaints of jaundice, fatigue, and dark-colored urine. Urine analysis was positive for hemosiderinuria and the flow cytometry results were negative for CD55 and CD59. Based on these findings, which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
When is the first dose of the rotavirus vaccine administered?

A 14-week-old girl's parents are very concerned about her health and brought her to the EPI vaccination center. According to the EPI schedule, which of the following sets of vaccines will she be given?
As per the EPI schedule, when is the MMR vaccine first administered?

A child with sickle cell disease has taken all preventive measures against infections and factors that can precipitate sickling but still develops complications. What should be the next best step in management?
A patient presents to you with a history of sickle cell disease and recurrent vaso-occlusive crisis. Which of the following measures is the next best step to prevent a sickling crisis in the future?

answers.option: Ultrasound of carotid artery with timely transfusions

question: A 50-year-old male presents to the clinic with persistent fatigue, weakness, recurrent infections, and ecchymosis. His laboratory investigations are as follows: hemoglobin (Hb) = 7 g/dl, platelets = 80,000/mm³, and white blood cell (WBC) = 52,000/mm³. A peripheral smear shows 83% blast cells. Which of the following features is most likely to be observed in this patient?

A group of medical students submits the plan for their research project to the institutional board. This plan contains background, objectives, hypothesis, methodology, consent form, questionnaire, and references. Which of the following best defines this plan for research given in the above scenario?

A group of researchers write a research proposal and in it they gave an explanation of the fundamental reasons for their research. Which of the following best describes the justification of the research work?
